Participatory scenario-building can help to explore the complex and uncertain #security effects of environmental challenges
Without adapting to #climate change threats with appropriate information and policy responses, results could cause instability and violence
In S. Caucasus and C. Asia, #climate threats to security include disasters & health impacts, water & food disputes, & economic deterioration
In E. and SE. Europe, #climate change threats to peace incl. #energy and #food insecurity, ethno-political tensions and population movements
In the S. Mediterranean, conflict risks include #water and food insecurity, displacement of people, political extremism and economic decline
In the #Arctic, conflict risks from climate change include resource & territorial disputes, livelihood challenges & militarisation of areas
With #EUNobel we must not forget the need for continued efforts to prevent conflict. Including to address the environmental risks.

Suggestion 4: Support a shift in #consumption patterns. Dietary shifts and reducing #food waste can mean big efficiency gains. #greenCAP

Europe needs to enhance efforts to reduce the generation of hazardous and other #waste through increased emphasis on waste prevention.
#eWaste is valuable but expensive to handle safely, creating incentives to exploit low wages and weaker protections in developing countries.
550,000 to 1,300,000 tonnes of #eWaste falsely classified as ‘used goods’ are shipped from the EU to Africa and Asia every year.
In 2000-2009 exports of hazardous #waste grew by 131%, whilst the amount of hazardous waste generated in the EU increased by 28%.
Trade in illegal #waste is growing. The main routes of illegal movements are from southern to south-eastern Europe and the western Balkans.
#Waste trade can create substantial financial returns and facilitate efficient use of resources, but it can also create significant harm.
The value of scrap iron and steel exports out of the EU has increased by a factor of eight between 1999 and 2011 to €18 billion. #waste

text: Reducing #GHG emissions through better transport, food and energy-use choices can all result in improved health.

Increasing temperatures and more variable rainfalls are expected to reduce crop yields, bringing further food insecurity. #agriculture
Global warming caused over 140,000 deaths per year between 1970 and 2004 http://t.co/RUMSchSL
Although global warming can bring some localised benefits, the overall health impacts are likely to be overwhelmingly negative
Scientists expect extreme weather events to become even more frequent and severe in the future due to #climate change
Reports of #extremeweather events and disasters have more than tripled since the 1960s http://t.co/wiog7YJU
Up to 90% of disasters from natural hazards during the last ten years resulted from floods, droughts, cyclones, heat waves and severe storms
